acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour LC50=1000microg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: There is no transdermal absorptions lethal toxicity data, and it cannot be classified.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: There was no suitable data for rats. So two mice data (ACGIH (2001)) were converted for 4 hours, and LC50: 120ppm and 61.5ppm were obtained. And it was classified as Category 1 based on he lower one. T+; R26 is used in the EU risk phrase.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: There are the value of 1700 mg/kg (RTECS (2004)) and 2600 mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)) in oral LD50 of rats. The lower one was adopted and it was set as Category 3.

aspiration_hazard.rationale: There is the statements of chemical pneumonia by steam inhalation (IUCLID (2000)), but there was no report of the influence by aspiration and we could not classify it.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since there was no test reports and there was also no evaluation result, and it presupposed "It cannot classify." Mr. Shirasu's experimental result recorded and selected by IUCLID (2000) is an evaluation of a fumatory agent and a methyl bromide, and is not a thing about an elements d bromine.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, and behavior in water and bioaccumulative potential are unknown.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: It is not necessary to do the examination defined in the United Nations, and is judged as "Category 1". Because reacting violently with aluminum is known (Bretherick (J) (1998)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance cannot be classified because there are no test reports about the mutagenicity.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Although oxygen, fluoride, and chlorine are not included, they are indicated to Enhances combustion of other substances on the ICSC cards. It is an oxidizing liquid. However, in UNRTDG, subsidiary risks nature 5.1 is not attached to the UN number 1744. Although it was thought that oxidizing powers did not exceed 65% nitrate which is a minimum standard substance of PG III, there was no released data. So it presupposed "It cannot classify." Although a possibility of be in outer category is large, references to risk of combustion aids should be attached to MSDS.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on toxic to rproduction and epidemiology.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: The animal experiment in ACGIH (2001) is exposure to a vapor, and is not what medicated the eye with the liquid. It is indicated as the eye stimulus in another part. HSFS (1998) also has severe eye description of stimulus. Since Category of a skin stimulus is 1, an eye is also set to "Category 1" by provision of GHS.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: The experimental result on rats is a stimulation (IUCLID (2000)). But there is a statement of skin corrosion on humans (Patty (5th.2001), HSDB (2005), HSFS (1998)), and the risks phrases of R35 was applied in EU. So it was classified as Category 1. There is no test data with sub-category A-C. But it is designated to be class 8 PG Division I by UNRTDG. So it is considered to be Category 1A.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (respiratory system, nervous system, endocrine system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system, nervous system, endocrine system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since it is reported of the effects on the respiratory, nervous and endcrine systems in the animal experiments of exposures which is below the guidance value (10mg of oral/kg/d, 50 ppm of inhalation (steam) / 6 h/d) of Category 1(ACGIH (2001), Patty (5th.2001)) , it was classified to as Category 1 regarding  these as target organs.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (respiratory system, central nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: By the animal experiments with an exposure amount (300ppm) which is less than the guidance value (2500ppm) of Category 1, dysfunction of the central nerve system, damages to lungs and bronchus, and bleeding in gastrointestinal mucosa are observed (ACGIH (2001)). Symptoms in connection with the respiratory organ-system and central nerve system are also indicated by humans (Patty (5th.2001)). So it was set as "Category 1(a central nervous system, respiratory-organ system)". The respiratory tract irritation was included in the respiratory systems. The effect on the digestive system is not adopted as organ toxicity because it is caused by the corrosiveness of this substance.
